messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] glucose syrup
messages.msgSnippet: The book I have has glucose syrup as an ingredient for rolled fondant icing, I m making dd2 s borthday cake for tomorrow, Gromit in a kennel, from a book...
messages.messageBody:
The book I have has glucose syrup as an ingredient for
'rolled fondant' icing, I'm making dd2's borthday cake
for tomorrow, Gromit in a kennel, from a book...

Tracy

I just looked in my Joy of Cooking that has a Basic
Fondant 1C Water, 3C Sugar 1/16t cream of tartar. 
Hope that helps give you proportions(sp?). The
directions are quite complex/ more than I feel like
typing at the moment.

hoping that helps,
Samantha


messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] glucose syrup
messages.msgSnippet: ... I just looked in my Joy of Cooking that has a Basic Fondant 1C Water, 3C Sugar 1/16t cream of tartar. Hope that helps give you proportions(sp?).  The
messages.messageBody:
--- Tracy Oldfield <tracy.oldfield@...>
wrote:
> for all those too skint/lazy/tight/stupid to go and
> buy this stuff in
> the shops, does anyone know if it's possible to make
> a sensible
> version (for making fondant icing) oneself, and if
> so, how does one
> go about it?

I just looked in my Joy of Cooking that has a Basic
Fondant 1C Water, 3C Sugar 1/16t cream of tartar.
Hope that helps give you proportions(sp?). The
directions are quite complex/ more than I feel like
typing at the moment.

hoping that helps,
Samantha

messages.subject: glucose syrup
messages.msgSnippet: for all those too skint/lazy/tight/stupid to go and buy this stuff in the shops, does anyone know if it s possible to make a sensible version (for making
messages.messageBody:
for all those too skint/lazy/tight/stupid to go and buy this stuff in
the shops, does anyone know if it's possible to make a sensible
version (for making fondant icing) oneself, and if so, how does one
go about it?

Tracy
